post_text:
It’s School Principals’ Day! Orinda USD is incredibly fortunate to have the best of the best leading our schools. From L to R top row Del Rey’s Kirsten Theurer (w/ David Schrag) and Glorietta’s Tracey Lewis; middle row OIS’s Stacy Wayne (center w/ David and me) and Maple Lai; bottom row Wagner Ranch’s Jim Manheimer and
Sleepy Hollow’s Patsy Templeton. So grateful for our team. #WeAreOrinda

post_text: Thank you to the Rotary Club of Orinda for inviting me to provide our members with an update on Orinda Union School District during today’s luncheon.
shared_text:
Orinda Rotary Club
August 28, 2019 at 7:31 PM ·

At our meeting earlier today we had the pleasure to have Dr. Carolyn Seaton, superintendent of Orinda Union School District give us information and update on Orinda schools from Kindergarten through 8th grade. It was really encouraging to hear that Orinda schools are ranked in the top one percent in the state and students excel in their education through top ranked teachers.
text:
Thank you to the Rotary Club of Orinda for inviting me to provide our members with an update on Orinda Union School District during today’s luncheon.

Orinda Rotary Club
August 28, 2019 at 7:31 PM ·

At our meeting earlier today we had the pleasure to have Dr. Carolyn Seaton, superintendent of Orinda Union School District give us information and update on Orinda schools from Kindergarten through 8th grade. It was really encouraging to hear that Orinda schools are ranked in the top one percent in the state and students excel in their education through top ranked teachers.

post_text: Our Orinda USD administrators know the recipe for a great school year! Add amazing students and outstanding teachers. Fold in dedicated classified staff and highly supportive parents. Let the mixture work together for 180 days, and the result is magic.
text: Our Orinda USD administrators know the recipe for a great school year! Add amazing students and outstanding teachers. Fold in dedicated classified staff and highly supportive parents. Let the mixture work together for 180 days, and the result is magic.

post_text:
Last night the Orinda Rotary honored our six Orinda USD Teachers of the Year for their outstanding pedagogy and leadership at a dinner at the Orinda Community Center. Each Teacher of the Year received a beautiful engraved plaque and an honorarium from Rotary. In addition, Mayor Inga Miller and Councilmember Nick Kosla provided each honoree with a certificate of appreciation from the city. It was a fabulous night for all!

The Orinda USD Teachers of the Year for 2019 are:

Del Rey: Jenny Dodd (Grades K and 1)
Glorietta: Terry Schrittwieser (Grade 1)
Sleepy Hollow: Beth Hoogerhuis (Special Education)
Wagner Ranch: Liz Headley (Grade 2)
OIS: Eric Page (Grade 7 Core)
Multiple Sites: Ashley Appel (Math Instructional Coach)

The District Teacher of the Year is Jenny Dodd! Ms. Dodd is representing Orinda USD in the Contra Costa County Office of Education Teachers of the Year process. Congratulations again to Ms. Dodd and to all of our outstanding school site Teachers of the Year on this well deserved recognition!

post_text: Congratulations to our 2019 Teacher of the Year, Jenny Dodd, and her fellow Lamorinda Teachers of the Year. Ms. Dodd is an inspiration to Del Rey students, their parents, and her colleagues at Del Rey Elementary and across the district. We are proud of her!
shared_text:
News24-680 updated their cover photo.
April 18, 2019 at 6:49 AM ·

Anyone know these four people? They are charged with educating the area's young folk in Lamorinda and have been doing a pretty good job of it, apparently, named Teachers of the Year candidates in the process.

They are: Cindy Fisher, Lafayette School District, Happy Valley Elementary School; Jennifer Dodd, Orinda Union School District, Del Rey Elementary School; Jennifer Strohmeyer, Moraga School District, Donald L. Rheem Elementary School; Paul Verbanszky, Acalanes Union High School District, Campolindo High School

Photo Credit: Jonathan Lance, CCCOE

Leave a digital apple for them in the comments section and pay attention in class...

post_text:
The next regular meeting of the Board of Trustees is Monday night, April 15th, beginning at 6 p.m. (Closed Session begins at 4 p.m.)

Items of interest to the public include:
*Recognition of OUSD Teachers of the Year and announcement of the District Teacher of the Year
*Board Resolution 19-12, California Day of the Teacher
*2020-2021 School Year Calendar
*Discussion regarding Transitional Kindergarten enrollment age

The meeting agenda and supporting documents are available at https://go.boarddocs.com/ca/orinda/Board.nsf/goto?open&id=B8VQ9P665E4E

All are welcome and encouraged to attend.

post_text: Our Peace Kits for Paradise Project benefitting Ponderosa Elementary students and staff is in full swing! We can’t thank the amazing Tanuka Gordon and her Mindful Littles team enough for making this service learning experience possible for our students.
shared_text:
Mindful Littles
March 19, 2019 at 3:07 PM ·

Tears and emotions were flowing on Day 4 of 8 of our OrindaCares Peace Kits for Paradise at Glorietta Elementary. We sent messages of hope and courage so that Paradise students realize they are braver than they think and more loved than they know. Today we had middle school student helpers who took the day off to join our service project as youth leaders. Thank you to everyone involved in making this such a meaningful experience- we are halfway through! 🙏🏾🙏🏾🙏🏾

#peace
#peaceandlove
#servicelearning
#givingback
#compassion
#mindfulness
#mindfullittles

The Educational Foundation of Orinda is excited to announce that ALL CONTRIBUTIONS made by 12/31/18 will be matched dollar for dollar up to $30,000 by a generous local donor! For more information, contact EFO Executive Director Darcie Taylor (dt@orindaefo.org). Please donate today!
https://www.orindaefo.org/donate-to-efo
